newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Tietmeyer says market reaction to G7 appropriate.
newsitem.headline: Tietmeyer says market reaction to G7 appropriate.

text.p: Bundesbank President Hans Tietmeyer said the reaction of financial markets to Saturday's Group of Seven meeting was appropriate up until now and the message was apparently understood.

Tietmeyer told reporters at the Bank for International Settlements that he had briefed the Group of 10 central bank governors on the G7 meeting in Berlin. He noted some G10 governors but not all had been present in Berlin.
"I informed them about the consensus reached in Berlin on the exchange rate side," he said.

Asked whether he was happy with markets' reaction to the G7 communique, Tietmeyer said: "Until now we saw the markets reacted in an approriate way. The message sent from Berlin seems to be understood by the markets."
